intro: Thesium micropogon, commonly known as the dwarf thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs. Thesium micropogon is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
